intro: Ficus hibiscifolia, commonly known as the Hibiscifolia Fig, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible figs. It thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-draining soil. Ficus hibiscifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage.
